Description: Card ID
Field checksum used for duplicate check: Integer representation of first 8 digits of sha1 hash of the first field

ID of the deck
Name of the deck
Due is used differently for different card types: new: note id or random int, due: integer day, relative to the collection's creation time, learning: integer timestamp
Which button you pushed to score your recall: review:  1(wrong), 2(hard), 3(ok), 4(easy), learn/relearn:   1(wrong), 2(ok), 3(easy)
The new ease factor of the card in permille (parts per thousand). If the ease factor is 2500, the card’s interval will be multiplied by 2.5 the next time you press Good.
The new ease factor of the card in permille (parts per thousand). If the ease factor is 2500, the card’s interval will be multiplied by 2.5 the next time you press Good.

Fields of the card as list. Anki database: fields as string joined by ‘\\x1f’ characters.
Globally unique id, almost certainly used for syncing
ID of the card (this corresponds to a epoch millisecond time stamp from the creating time)
ID of the note (this corresponds to a epoch millisecond time stamp from the creating time)
ID of the review (this corresponds to a epoch millisecond time stamp from the creating time)
The new interval that the card was pushed to after the review. Positive values are in days, negative values are in seconds (for learning cards).
The new interval that the card was pushed to after the review. Positive values are in days, negative values are in seconds (for learning cards).
The number of times the card went from a "was answered correctly" to "was answered incorrectly" state
Last interval
Of the form ``a*1000+b``, with: ``b`` the number of reps left till graduation and ``a`` the number of reps left today
Model ID
Name of the model
Modification time [epoch seconds]
Modification timestamp, epoch seconds
ID of the note
Original did: only used when the card is currently in filtered deck
Origina deck: only used when the card is currently in filtered deck
Original due: only used when the card is currently in filtered deck
Identifies which of the card templates the card corresponds to. Valid values are from 0 to num templates -1

In the Anki db this is -3=sched buried, -2=user buried, -1=suspended, 0=new, 1=learning, 2=due (as for type), 3=in learning, next rev in at least a day after the previous review. In AnkiPandas this is already translated.
Number of reviews
Content of the sort field.
Tags of the note as list. Anki database: tags as space joined string.
How many milliseconds your review took, up to 60000 (60s)

In the Anki db this is 0 for learning cards, 1 for review cards, 2 for relearn cards, and 3 for cram cards (cards being studied in a filtered deck when they are not due). In AnkiPandas this is already translated.

In the Anki db this  is 0 for learning cards, 1 for review cards, 2 for relearn cards, and 3 for cram cards (cards being studied in a filtered deck when they are not due). In AnkiPandas this is already translated.

This column is used to keep track of the sync state of reviews and provides no useful information for analysis. update sequence number: used to figure out diffs when syncing. value of -1 indicates changes that need to be pushed to server. usn < server usn indicates changes that need to be pulled from server.
